intro: Borreria remota, commonly known as the Mexican dwarf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pale blue to violet in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Borreria remota is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
